DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study determine cervical hardness score ( determined cervical ultrasound elastography ) predict delivery mode ( vaginal versus cesarian slow dilatation ( 2-3h without fetal suffering ) regardless induction mode ( ocytocin alone intravaginal device release PGE2 ) .
DOC.brief_title: Elastography Evaluating Cervical Maturity Preparation Labor Induction 37 42 Weeks Gestation
DOC.detailed_description: The secondary objective study : A . To determine composite criterion ( combine elastographic , parity Bishop score information ) predict delivery mode . B . To determine prognostic value elastography concern delivery within 24 hour among patient induced via oxytocin intravaginal device release PGE2 ( Bishop score < 6 ) . C. To determine prognostic value elastography concern delivery mode ( vaginal versus cesarian slow dilatation ( 2-3h without fetal suffering ) ) among patient induced via oxytocin alone . D. To evaluate intra- inter-operator reproducibility cervical hardness score determine via elastography . E. To evaluate economic impact use cervical hardness score point view French social system ( French health insurance ) hospital .
